TransferValueFrom.Name: Packet Switched Networks
TransferValueFrom.Description: Understanding of terminology and issues and their application in functioning packet switched networks.
Subject: packet switching overview
evolution of packet switching and public networks
physical level protocols
link level protocols
packet level protocols
network services

BISYNC connections

TransferValueFrom.LearningMethodDescription: Methods of instruction include lecture, discussion, laboratory exercises, videotapes, and a final examination.

Teaches.TargetNodeDescription: Upon successful completion of this course, the student will be able to describe packet technology; and discuss the history of public packet networks--their practical implementation and management issues related to implementation.
